skillTree.localised_description: Hailing from deep within the forests of the Old World, this dragon breathes deadly, poisonous fumes instead of fire.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can fire while on the move.

skillTree.localised_description: Elven hunters emulate Kurnous, the God of the Hunt. Their speed and swiftness is therefore without peer.
A ranger should give no reprieve to the foe. Arrows must fall like a deluge, as deadly as lightning.
Sceolan of the Hooked Blade is one of the oldest and most cunning of the Wood Elf warriors.
Sceolan has a tactical mind for finding the enemy at their weakest and making them suffer.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: "Not only does he use the longbow, but he is an expert hand-to-hand fighter"

effects.description:
Melee attack: +8 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +8% for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Sceolan is the ruler of the High Realm of Atylwyth, also known as the Winterheart. "Nowhere else in Athel Loren can Eternal Guard be found in such numbers as they can in the halls and holds of Lord Sceolan"

effects.description:
Melee attack: +10 for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: These battle-hardened warriors fight with unmatched skill and unwavering loyalty.

effects.description:
Unit capacity: +2
	Wraiths of the Frozen Heart (Dryads)
	Winterheart Guards (Eternal Guard - Shields)

Weapon strength: +20% for Wraiths of the Frozen Heart (Dryads) and Winterheart Guards (Eternal Guard - Shields) units

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When the arrow flies farther, it may kill sooner, which is vital in the Hunt.
Nook and fire. Nook again, and fire. Nook a third time, and fire. All in a heartbeat.
The forest teaches a warrior not only when to fire but where, which makes a bigger difference.
Always willing to fight on, a widened quiver allows arrows to rain, almost without end.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
By all means summon the bloodthirsty Goddess of the Hunt to assist you, but always make sure you thank her afterwardsâ€¦
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Taking their cue from the forest itself, the Lord endures and overcomes all.
Using the forest itself as a shield, this Lord is protected by their devotion to Athel Loren.
When to strike, when to block, when to dodge. These are all skills the warriors of Athel Loren must perfect.
There is no greater thrill than to be in the midst of battle, slaughtering in the forest's name.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
The Lord embodies the forest; as a result of this, their warriors feel a greater call to defend it.
The Lord charges their troops to fight for Athel Loren, for their very souls are tethered to its fate.
The Lord sets their eye upon the foe, imbuing their troops with Kurnous' spirit and the will to see his enemies destroyed.
This Lord can spot an enemy at a distance that defies belief, and demands their troops do the same.
This ritualistic war dance requires neither rhythm nor order, enabling evasion of the enemyâ€™s clumsy attacks, and lethal counterattacks.
Once consumed by Loecâ€™s aspect, one can instinctively evade attack through trickery, mimicking his deception of the Dark Gods.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Possessed by the Trickster God"

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75

skillTree.localised_description: Every blade and barbed branch will eventually find its mark â€“ when they do, the forestâ€™s infinite anger is truly felt.

skillTree.localised_description: All of Athel Loren shouts with a fury as old as the ages, and the enemy knows its power.

skillTree.localised_description: The denizens of the forest will travel many miles to see those who would threaten Athel Loren put to rout.
Athel Loren provides for its deserving children, with wondrous boons gifted in recognition of their many endeavours.
The Worldroots provide succour for their children, purging the forests of any corrupting infestation.
The magics of the woods obscure and connive, able to turn enemy blades away from their targets.
The forest provides for its warriors, rehabilitating and regenerating wounds suffered in its defence.
From all corners of the forest, they come to defend their homes.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: The dead do not want for material possessions, yet the living may yet find value in themâ€¦

skillTree.localised_description: Like the forest itself, the warriors of Athel Loren ebb and flow and regenerate with the passing of time.
A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The forest-dwellers draw from the strength of Kurnous to fight ever harder, and be ever stronger.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can fire while on the move.
This unit can pass through trees.

factionEffects.localised_description: Far away from the High Realm of Atylwyth, the exiled warrior Sceolan plans his definitive return to the Oak Glades.

effects.description: Embrace the Cold: Recieves bonuses for entering regions with a frozen climate and magical forests.
Spellsingers and Spellweavers have access to the lore of Ice

Weapon strength: +10% for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(all armies)

items.colour_text: Sceolan carries a buckler instead of an ordinary shield. This is a small shield with a spiked front, the spikes are arranged in an arcane pattern

	(Lord's army)

items.colour_text: The Bow of Loren is strung with the hair of Elf maids and enchanted with potent charms for increased power.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Unlike other regions of the forest, Atylwyth's defence has ever relied upon the bravery and battle-skill of the Elves alone"
